1100788137859694593.text:
As much as I want it to happen, I don't buy the narrative that people want to own their data:

- Very few use a VPN
- Max value captured by consumer is LTV ($5 for FB)
- Metadata is nearly impossible to hide
- Rarely protest egregious breaches of their privacy (ex: NSA/FB)

976476290629988352.text: Worried about legal implications of blockchain storing files? Look to Ethereum Swarm as a savior. Only file pointers go on chain, and those will point to P2P storage of encrypted shards. No machine on Earth will be said to have even a usable fragment of a file.
